1. Tarlatamab Significantly Prolongs Survival in Relapsed Small Cell Lung Cancer (DeLLphi-304 Trial) 2. Lurbinectedin Plus Atezolizumab Maintenance Improves Outcomes in Extensive-Stage SCLC (IMforte Trial) 3. Neoadjuvant Nivolumab + Chemotherapy Shows 5-Year OS Benefit in Resectable NSCLC (CheckMate 816 Update) 4. FDA Approves Taletrectinib – Next-Generation ROS1 Inhibitor for ROS1-Positive NSCLC 5. Dupilumab Approved for Children (6–11 Years) with Moderate-to-Severe Asthma as Add-On Therapy 6. As-Needed Albuterol/Budesonide (Airsupra) Cuts Severe Exacerbations ~50% in Mild Asthma (BATURA Trial) 7. New Antifibrotic Nerandomilast Slows Lung Function Decline in Progressive Pulmonary Fibrosis (FIBRONEER Trial) 8. Ganciclovir Prophylaxis in CMV+ ICU Patients Fails to Improve Outcomes and Raises Mortality (GRAIL Trial) 9. Azithromycin Provides No Benefit for Acute Wheezing in Preschool Children (AZ-SWED Study) 10. Intensive CT Surveillance of Small Pulmonary Nodules Yields No Outcome Advantage over Standard Monitoring (

Trial) 11. Tezepelumab Helps Severe Asthmatics Greatly Reduce or Eliminate Daily Oral Steroids (WAYFINDER Study) 12. Nalbuphine Extended-Release (Haduvio) Dramatically Reduces Chronic Cough in Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (Phase 2b CORAL Trial) 13. Mepolizumab (Nucala) Wins FDA Approval as First Biologic for COPD with Eosinophilic Inflammation 14. ATS 2025 Updates Guidelines on Severe Asthma: Stronger Emphasis on Biologic Selection by Endotype 15. CHEST 2025 Unveils Risk-Based Algorithm for PE Diagnosis Reducing CT Angiography Utilization Safely

1. FDA approval of taletrectinib (Ibtrozi) for ROS1-positive advanced non–small cell lung cancer 2. FDA approval of clesrovimab (Enflonsia) monoclonal antibody to prevent RSV lower respiratory tract disease in infants entering their first RSV season 3. Phase 3 trial shows Tarlatamab (bispecific T-cell engager) significantly improves overall and progression-free survival vs chemotherapy in relapsed small cell lung cancer 4. CheckMate 816 trial confirms neoadjuvant nivolumab plus chemotherapy significantly improves overall survival in resectable NSCLC 5. Phase 3 FIBRONEER trials: oral PDE4B inhibitor Nerandomilast significantly slows forced vital capacity decline in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and progressive fibrosing ILD 6. New CHEST guidelines promote restrictive RBC, plasma, and platelet transfusion practices in critically ill adults, citing no mortality difference and fewer adverse events vs liberal transfusion 7. FDA approval of Mepolizumab (Nucala) as the first add-on biologic for eosinophilic COPD to reduce exacerbations and slow disease progression 8. FDA grants accelerated approval to Datopotamab Deruxtecan (TROP2-targeted ADC) for EGFR-mutated metastatic NSCLC after EGFR TKI and chemo, based on a 45% response rate in trials 9. New evidence links pulmonary rehabilitation to improved survival in ILD – 5-year mortality was 44% lower in ILD patients who completed rehab vs controls, underscoring PR as standard care in ILD 10. FDA approval of Telisotuzumab Vedotin (Emrelis), an anti-c-Met antibody–drug conjugate, for advanced MET-overexpressing NSCLC after prior systemic therapy 11. ACIP endorses Merck's RSV antibody Enflonsia (clesrovimab) for all infants <8 months old entering their first RSV season, expanding routine infant RSV prophylaxis 12. ACIP expands RSV vaccine recommendations to include adults aged 50–59 with underlying conditions, lowering the prior age threshold (60+) for RSV vaccination in high-risk U.S. adults 13. Mixed phase 3 results for IL-33 inhibitor Itepekimab in COPD – one trial showed a 27% exacerbation reduction, but a second trial failed to meet its endpoint – raise uncertainty about its approval 14. FDA approval of Yutrepia (treprostinil inhalation powder) for pulmonary arterial hypertension and PH-ILD, providing a convenient dry-powder inhaled treprostinil option for over 100,000 patients 15. NIH PrecISE adaptive trial in severe asthma reports initial findings, highlighting how biomarker-driven, precision therapies can improve outcomes for subgroups of severe, exacerbation-prone asthma
